## Statutes

### Free Official/Semi-Official Sources

- **[New York State Legislature - Laws of New York](https://public.leginfo.state.ny.us/lawssrch.cgi)** - Official unannotated text of the Consolidated Laws and unconsolidated laws. Access via web interface; no API. Updated regularly.

- **[NY Senate Open Legislation](https://legislation.nysenate.gov/)** - Provides current statutory text through the same platform as bills. Free REST API available (requires registration for API key).

- **[Cornell LII - New York](https://www.law.cornell.edu/states/new_york)** - Free access to NY Constitution and Consolidated Laws with clean interface. Links to official sources. No API but well-organized for browsing.

### Paid Annotated Codes

- **McKinney's Consolidated Laws of New York Annotated** (Westlaw/Thomson Reuters) - The primary annotated code used by practitioners. Includes case annotations, practice commentaries, and session law citations. Subscription required.

- **New York Consolidated Laws Service (CLS)** (Lexis) - Alternative annotated code with similar features. Subscription required.

### Session Laws

- **[NYS Legislative Library](https://legislativelibrary.ny.gov/legislative-resources)** - Session Laws (chapter laws) from legislative sessions. Web access.

## Bills in Flight

### Official Sources

- **[NY Assembly Bill Search](https://nyassembly.gov/leg/)** - Official Assembly bill tracking. Web interface for searching current and prior session bills.

- **[NY Senate Open Legislation](https://legislation.nysenate.gov/)** - Primary resource for real-time bill tracking. Offers a free [REST API](https://legislation.nysenate.gov/static/docs/html/index.html) (registration required) returning JSON. Includes bill text, sponsors, committee assignments, votes, and status. [Open source](https://github.com/nysenate/OpenLegislation/).

- **[Leginfo](http://public.leginfo.state.ny.us/navigate.cgi)** - Older official interface for bill search, still functional.

### Third-Party Tracking

- **[LegiScan - New York](https://legiscan.com/NY)** - Aggregates NY legislative data with API access. Free tier available; enhanced features require subscription.

## Legislative History

Legislative history materials for New York are more limited than federal sources. Key materials include: bills, sponsor's memoranda, governor's messages, bill jackets, and (rarely) hearing transcripts.

### Research Guides

- **[NYS Library Legislative History Tutorial](https://www.nysl.nysed.gov/leghist)** - Comprehensive free tutorial from the State Library.
- **[NYU Law - NY Legislative History](https://nyulaw.libguides.com/c.php?g=773848&p=5551755)** - Academic research guide.
- **[Brooklyn Law - NYS Legislative History](https://guides.brooklaw.edu/NYS_legislative_history_research)** - Detailed guide with finding aids.
- **[Georgetown Law - NY Legislative History](https://guides.ll.georgetown.edu/c.php?g=277242&p=7664166)** - Overview of available documents and locations.

### Bill Jackets

Bill jackets contain memoranda, correspondence, and other materials considered by the Governor when signing or vetoing bills. Unique to New York legislative history research.

- **[NYS Archives Digital Collections - Bill Jackets](https://digitalcollections.archives.nysed.gov/index.php/Detail/collections/7782)** - Free PDF downloads of Governor's bill jackets from 1995 to present. Searchable by year, chapter, or keyword.

- **[NYS Library Bill Jackets](https://www.nysl.nysed.gov/billjack)** - Holdings for 1905 and 1921-2009 (microform and CD-ROM). Some digitized in library's digital collections.

### Session Laws and Governor's Messages

- Governor's approval and veto messages are published with the Session Laws and are often the most accessible legislative history documents.

## Regulations

### Current Regulations

- **[NYCRR (Unofficial Online Version)](https://dos.ny.gov/rules-and-regulations)** - Department of State hosts an unofficial but free version of the New York Codes, Rules and Regulations, powered by Westlaw. Web access; no API.

- **[Cornell LII - NYCRR](https://www.law.cornell.edu/regulations/new-york)** - Free browsable collection of NY regulations by title. Updated quarterly. Clean interface for navigating regulatory text.

- **[NYCRR on Westlaw/Lexis](https://www.westlaw.com)** - Official and annotated NYCRR available on both commercial platforms. Subscription required.

### Proposed Rules and Rulemaking

- **[New York State Register](https://dos.ny.gov/state-register)** - Official journal of state government published weekly. Contains Notices of Proposed Rule Making and Notices of Adoption. Free online from 2007-present.

### Historical Regulations

- **[NYCRR Digital Archive](http://law.lib.buffalo.edu/nycrr/)** (UB Law Library) - Free access to superseded NYCRR pages ("takeouts") for 1945-2001 in PDF format.

### Agency-Specific

Individual agencies often publish their regulations on their own websites (e.g., [DEC Regulations](https://dec.ny.gov/regulatory/regulations), [Education Department](https://www.counsel.nysed.gov/rulesandregs)).

## Judicial Opinions

### Official Free Sources

- **[NY Courts - Official Reports](https://www.nycourts.gov/reporter/decisions.shtml)** - Free access to Court of Appeals and Appellate Division decisions from 1956-present. Slip opinions available same-day for Court of Appeals. Web interface; no public API.

- **[Court-PASS](https://www.nycourts.gov/ctapps/courtpass.htm)** - Court of Appeals Public Access and Search System. Free access to Court of Appeals materials for cases filed after January 1, 2013.

- **[NY eCourts](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcivil/ecourtsMain)** - Case information and filings for state courts. Primarily docket/status information rather than full opinions.

- **[NYSCEF Case Search](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/nyscef/CaseSearch)** - New York State Courts Electronic Filing system. Access to filed documents in participating courts.

### Free Third-Party Sources

- **[Cornell LII](https://www.law.cornell.edu/states/new_york)** - Links to NY court opinions and encyclopedic legal information. Strong for constitutional and statutory interpretation context.
- **[Google Scholar](https://scholar.google.com/)** - Searchable NY case law. Free but unofficial; useful for quick research.
- **[Justia](https://law.justia.com/cases/new-york/)** - Free NY case law database.
- **[Findlaw](https://caselaw.findlaw.com/court/ny-supreme-court)** - NY Supreme Court opinions from 1959-present.

### Paid Commercial Databases

- **Westlaw** (Thomson Reuters) - Comprehensive NY case law with headnotes, KeyCite citator, and secondary sources. The standard for most NY practitioners. Subscription required.

- **Lexis+** (LexisNexis) - Comparable coverage with Shepard's citator. Subscription required.
